page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: This area is in the valley of the River Font and is primarily devoted to farming and woodland. The farming ranges from arable to rough grazing, with a mixture of cattle and sheep. Netherwitton Village, and the surrounding land, is almost wholly owned by one landowner, Raleigh Trevelyan, whose family have run the estate for many generations. He lives in Netherwitton Hall which dates back to the 15th Century. The other listed buildings are Font House and an old derelict mill. The population has diminished during the last 100 years from a flourishing community with their own craftsmen and shops, and a local industry at the woolen mill. The present population is about 100, most of whom work on the land. Others commute to Morpeth or Newcastle.
